009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.Illuminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.Illuminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017
018/**
019 * This class implements the CIELab color space.
020 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
021 * coordinates, i.e., without conversion to Java's D50-based profile 
022 * connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ 
023 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space.
024 * 
025 * @author W. Burger
026 * @version 2022/09/01
027 */
028@SuppressWarnings("serial")
029public class LabColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
030
031        // D65 reference white point:
032        private static final double Xref = D65.getX();  // 0.950456
033        private static final double Yref = D65.getY();  // 1.000000
034        private static final double Zref = D65.getZ();  // 1.088754
035
036        // chromatic adaptation objects:
037        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = new BradfordAdaptation(D65, D50);
038        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = new BradfordAdaptation(D50, D65);
039
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor.
043         */
044        public LabColorSpace() {
045                super(TYPE_Lab, 3);
046        }
047
048        // XYZ50 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D50)
049        /**
050         * {@inheritDoc}
051         * <p>
052         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) assumes that 
053         * the specified color coordinate is in D50-based XYZ space (with components in [0,1]).
054         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
055         * </p>
056         */
057        @Override
058        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
059                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);     
060                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
061        }
062
063        // XYZ65 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D65)
064        /**
065         * Converts color points in D65-based XYZ space to CIELab coordinates.
066         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])}.
067         * @param XYZ65 a color in D65-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
068         * @return the associated CIELab color
069         */
070        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {
071                double xx = f1(XYZ65[0] / Xref);        
072                double yy = f1(XYZ65[1] / Yref);
073                double zz = f1(XYZ65[2] / Zref);
074                float L = (float)(116.0 * yy - 16.0);
075                float a = (float)(500.0 * (xx - yy));
076                float b = (float)(200.0 * (yy - zz));
077                return new float[] {L, a, b};
078        }
079
080        // CIELab -> XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Lab
081        /**
082         * {@inheritDoc}
083         * <p>
084         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) converts a
085         * CIELab color to a color coordinate in D50-based XYZ space.
086         * See also {@link #toCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
087         * </p>
088         */
089        @Override
090        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Lab) {
091                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
092                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
093        }
094
095        // CIELab -> XYZ65: returns XYZ values (relative to D65) from Lab
096        /**
097         * Converts the specified CIELab color to D65-based XYZ coordinates.
098         * @param Lab CIELab color
099         * @return D65-based XYZ coordinates
100         */
101        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Lab) {
102                double ll = ( Lab[0] + 16.0 ) / 116.0;
103                float Y65 = (float) (Yref * f2(ll));
104                float X65 = (float) (Xref * f2(ll + Lab[1] / 500.0));
105                float Z65 = (float) (Zref * f2(ll - Lab[2] / 200.0));
106                return new float[] {X65, Y65, Z65};
107        }
108
109        //sRGB -> CIELab (direct, without adaptation to D50)
110        /**
111         * {@inheritDoc}
112         * <p>
113         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) converts a
114         * D65-based sRGB color coordinate assumed to the associated
115         * CIELab color.
116         * </p>
117         */
118        @Override
119        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
120                float[] XYZ65 = new sRgb65ColorSpace().toCIEXYZ(srgb);
121                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
122        }
123
124        //CIELab -> sRGB (direct, without adaptation to D50)
125        /**
126         * {@inheritDoc}
127         * <p>
128         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) converts a
129         * CIELab color to a D65-based sRGB color coordinate.
130         * </p>
131         */
132        @Override
133        public float[] toRGB(float[] Lab) {
134                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
135                float[] srgb = new sRgb65ColorSpace().fromCIEXYZ(XYZ65);
136                return srgb;
137        }
138
139        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
140
141        private static final double epsilon = 216.0/24389;
142        private static final double kappa = 841.0/108;
143
144        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
145        private double f1 (double c) {
146                return (c > epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
147        }
148
149        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
150        private double f2 (double c) {
151                double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
152                return (c3 > epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / kappa;
153        }
154
155}
